page.title: 01Gazeteer Page
page.content: The designated region stretches from Alderwasley in the north-west to Ambergate in the south-east,including the settlements of Fritchley,Crich and Bullbridge.The area is divided in half by the quadruple transport routes of the River Derwent,the A6,the Matlock- Derby railway line and the Cromford Canal.The main residential area is the village of Fritchley,which is located in East Derbyshire 3 miles north of Belper.With a population of just over 600,the village derives its name from Frychisleagh,which means "the meadows where the fir trees stand."Fritchley was once a small industrial centre with such home industries as hat and stocking making,spinning and weaving. Other employment was provided at corn mills,local lime quarries and railroads,but more recently,Fritchley has become a commuter village.
